page.title: 11THOUGHTS ON CRESTWOOD CENTRE
page.content: One person who regularly uses the Centre looks at the North Eastleigh development as a 'village' because it is smaller than a town but larger than a hamlet and when she visits the complex it's like going down to the village hall to meet the local neighbours.Another person thought that the building when lit up was like a {'Cruise Ship"}passing in the night for he could hear disco music being emitted and along with the people attending Keep Fit, Ballet, Meetings, Classes, and the Bar Lounge, it all contributes to an exciting nightly entertainment programme. My favourite description was that the red building was their{'Space Centre'}with their own house as the satellite and from an architectural point of view you could say that the sunshaped building emits heatrays and attracts people inside.
